org.jmotif.timeseries

Class TSUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jmotif.timeseries.TSUtils

  • public final class TSUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements algorithms for low-level data manipulation.
    Author:
    Pavel Senin

      • readTS

        public static Timeseries readTS(java.lang.String filename,
                                int sizeLimit)
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                java.io.IOException,
                                TSException
        Reads timeseries from a file. Assumes that file has a single double value on every line. Assigned timestamps are the line numbers.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to read from.
        sizeLimit - The number of lines to read.
        Returns:
        Timeseries.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if error occurs.
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs.
        TSException - if error occurs.

      • paa

        public static Timeseries paa(Timeseries ts,
                             int paaSize)
                      throws TSException,
                             java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Approximate the timeseries using PAA. If the timeseries has some NaN's they are handled as follows: 1) if all values of the piece are NaNs - the piece is approximated as NaN, 2) if there are some (more or equal one) values happened to be in the piece - algorithm will handle it as usual - getting the mean.
        Parameters:
        ts - The timeseries to approximate.
        paaSize - The desired length of approximated timeseries.
        Returns:
        PAA-approximated timeseries.
        Throws:
        TSException - if error occurs.
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - if error occurs.

      • paa

        public static double[] paa(double[] ts,
                           int paaSize)
                    throws TSException
        Approximate the timeseries using PAA. If the timeseries has some NaN's they are handled as follows: 1) if all values of the piece are NaNs - the piece is approximated as NaN, 2) if there are some (more or equal one) values happened to be in the piece - algorithm will handle it as usual - getting the mean.
        Parameters:
        ts - The timeseries to approximate.
        paaSize - The desired length of approximated timeseries.
        Returns:
        PAA-approximated timeseries.
        Throws:
        TSException - if error occurs.

      • optimizedPaa

If the timeseries has some NaN's they are handled as follows: 1) if all values of the piece are NaNs - the piece is approximated as NaN, 2) if there are some (more or equal one) values happened to be in the piece - algorithm will handle it as usual - getting the mean.
        Parameters:
        ts - The timeseries to approximate.
        paaSize - The desired length of approximated timeseries.
        Returns:
        PAA-approximated timeseries.

      • ts2String

        public static char[] ts2String(Timeseries series,
                               Alphabet alphabet,
                               int alphabetSize)
                        throws TSException
        Converts a timeseries into the string using alphabet cuts.
        Parameters:
        series - The timeseries to convert.
        alphabet - The alphabet to use.
        alphabetSize - The alphabet size.
        Returns:
        Symbolic (SAX) representation of timeseries.
        Throws:
        TSException - if error occurs.

      • ts2String

        public static char[] ts2String(double[] vals,
                               double[] cuts)
        Converts the timeseries into string using given cuts intervals. Useful for not-normal distribution cuts.
        Parameters:
        vals - The timeseries.
        cuts - The cut intervals.
        Returns:
        The timeseries SAX representation.
